intro: Halophila spinulosa, commonly known as the spinulose halophyte, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, delicate leaves that are adapted to brackish and saltwater environments. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in seagrass beds. Halophila spinulosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms.
